lines.text: Gee, Pop, you sure missed a wonderful luncheon!

[at the shiprail suffering from seasickness]
Contradiction, please. Not having eaten have missed nothing.
I had turtle soup, chicken a la king, and three cream puffs. Then I had some ice cream.
Please stop! Mention of food more painful than surgeon's knife without anesthesia.
Shall I get you medicine, Pop?
Good dose of land only effective medicine.

[breaking into ship cabin because of screams]
Sorry to intrude but etiquette ignored when lady in distress.

[on the pier with other police to welcome Charlie Chan]
Look, Smitty, have the band blast at somethin' Oriental. Hey, what is the Chinese national anthem anyway?
I don' know. Why don't you give 'em 'Chinatown, My Chinatown?'
Okay, we'll play it.

[annoyed by Lee's whistling]
Put a muzzle on peanut whistle.
Looks like you got half of headquarters down here. What's up?
lines.character: Speed Patten, Reporter New York Bulletin

lines.text: I'm lookin' for the other half.
Expect someone to steal the Atlantic?
lines.character: Speed Patten, Reporter New York Bulletin

lines.text: No, the boys are goin' wading.
I wish the fishing season was as open as the one for murder.

[at testimonial dinner]
Police of New York and Honolulu have one thing in common. Both live on very small island, but while we have small volcano, you have biggest shakeup.
Mud of bewilderment beginning to clear from pool of thought.
Mr. Chan?
That is humble name.
I'm Inspector Nelson, Mr. Chan. Greetings from New York's Finest. The bigwigs expect you to tear a duck apart with 'em tonight.
So sorry, come again please?
You'll have to excuse the inspector's English, Mr. Chan. He's a Brooklyn immigrant.
lines.character: Speed Patten, Reporter New York Bulletin

lines.text: Camera remember many things human eye forget.

[referring to the tell-all diary]
No poison more deadly than ink.
But murder like revolving door - when one side close, other side open.
Someday hope to greet honorable brothers where roar of surf replace noise of subway and hot rhythm of Broadway cooled by strains of 'Aloha.'

[to Lee]
Keep eyes open, and mouth *closed*!

[to Lee]
*One* cabin not big enough for *two* detectives!
